title: General Government and Appropriations Amendments

history.action: Bill Numbered but not Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel
Numbered Bill Publicly Distributed in Legislative Research and General Counsel

general_provisions: This bill amends provisions related to government departments and legislative appropriations.
hilighted_provisions: This bill:<hr><ltbullet>repeals the Rural Health Care Facilities restricted account;<hr><ltbullet>appropriates money to the State Tax Commission (tax commission) for distribution to certain counties and municipalities to improve the delivery of health care in rural areas of the state;<hr><ltbullet>requires the insurance commissioner to update the state's essential health benefits plan with benefits mandated since January 1, 2012;<hr><ltbullet>allows the insurance commissioner to update the plan described above to incorporate federally mandated benefits under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act;<hr><ltbullet>repeals the tax commission's reporting requirements related to the tax commission's collection of the beer excise tax;<hr><ltbullet>authorizes the Labor Commission (commission) to use certain restricted account funds to pay the salary and benefits of a compliance officer for the commission's Division of Occupational Safety and Health; <hr><ltbullet>grants the Department of Government Operations (department) the authority to operate the department as an internal service fund agency to provide certain government-related services;<hr><ltbullet>establishes a process for an internal service fund agency to compensate the agency's employees at a rate that is equivalent to state agency employees by submitting a proposed increased rate schedule to the rate committee after the annual legislative session;<hr><ltbullet>requires the rate committee to convene a meeting within 30 days of receiving the rate schedule described above to review and approve or reject the increased rate schedule;<hr><ltbullet>repeals an outdated reference to the former Department of Administrative Services; and<hr><ltbullet>makes technical and conforming changes.
